comment_body:
> I'm thinking if we could disable the oscillation session-wise and put the config saved into the golden config, let's discuss this offline.

NO. We are NOT putting this into the gold config. This feature is meant to be enabled in production. Thought I made it clear already.

> > I'm thinking if we could disable the oscillation session-wise and put the config saved into the golden config, let's discuss this offline.
> 
> NO. We are NOT putting this into the gold config. This feature is meant to be enabled in production. Thought I made it clear already.

Yes, I understand your concern. As I said before, we can put this as a test gap and add dedicated testcases for it.
This DOES impact our passing rate for 202311, are you going to use this approach to disable the oscillation one testcase by one testcase for features failing due to oscillation like QoS, PFCWD, drop counters etc? 
Those T0 features doesn't take the oscillation into consideration when designing the testcases.

> > > I'm thinking if we could disable the oscillation session-wise and put the config saved into the golden config, let's discuss this offline.
> > 
> > 
> > NO. We are NOT putting this into the gold config. This feature is meant to be enabled in production. Thought I made it clear already.
> 
> Yes, I understand your concern. As I said before, we can put this as a test gap and add dedicated testcases for it. This DOES impact our passing rate for 202311, are you going to use this approach to disable the oscillation one testcase by one testcase for features failing due to oscillation like QoS, PFCWD, drop counters etc? Those T0 features doesn't take the oscillation into consideration when designing the testcases.

1. This fixture is session wise already if you checked the code.
2. why is gold config involved here?
@lolyu if you meant the config diff checker, we can add it to exclude list like "LINK_PROBER"
@yxieca Can you please approve the cherry-pick?
